name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
North Korea will cut off all communications with South Korea and treat it as an "enemy," according to North Korea's state media. 

The move comes just a month after the countries traded fire at their heavily patrolled border.
https://t.co/FWEc5XDOnz

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
Activists in Bristol, U.K., had spent years trying to remove the statue of slave trader Edward Colston, to no avail.

In the end, the statue's fate was not resolved by lawmakers in Bristol, but by a killing on a sidewalk in Minneapolis.  
https://t.co/OEWfA1T0jc

name: NPR
text:
After being laid off, Liz had to suddenly work out how to find health insurance coverage in the middle of a pandemic.

It wasn't easy: She had to call the county, talk to the insurance company, and navigate a difficult application. It took weeks to enroll.
https://t.co/z8wq1OPnu7

name: NPR
text: RT @NPRnie: "NPR has reviewed court documents of 51 individuals facing federal charges in connection with the unrest. As of Tuesday morning, none is alleged to have links to the antifa movement." Reporting by @relucasz  https://t.co/fEPu4PUUR4

text:

name: NPR
text:
IBM will stop selling its facial recognition technology amid nationwide protests for racial justice and police reform.

The company cited fears that such technology could be used by police to violate "basic human rights and freedoms."  https://t.co/qK9Akdx3d9

name: NPR
text:

text:

text: Over the weekend, authors took to Twitter to share what they were paid for their books under the hashtag #PublishingPaidMe ‚Äî and to highlight pay disparities "between what's paid to non-Black authors vs. Black authors." https://t.co/OndQ4KDZ4h

name: NPR
text:

"We've got to start making it uncomfortable," she says. "Because the forces of comfort are quite seductive."
https://t.co/y3gi5B2dgE

name: NPR
text:
Companies like Uber, Airbnb and Rent the Runway tapped the power of smartphone apps to make it easy for strangers to share ‚Äî upending the traditional taxi, hotel and retail industries.

Now, the pandemic may upend them. üëá
https://t.co/492ugrlAcV

name: NPR
text:

Some have returned to an old art form ‚Äì‚Äì the radio drama, but with a digital twist. https://t.co/PtDvvVD0R9

name: NPR
text:

But an NPR review found no alleged links to Antifa in any Justice Department cases brought over unrest so far.

name: NPR
text:

But to speed up production, companies must start making a vaccine in large quantities even before it's clear a vaccine works.

text:

text: WATCH LIVE: The House Judiciary Committee holds hearings on racial profiling and policing following the killing of George Floyd.  https://t.co/p25Tv3iyhY

text:

text:

name: NPR
text:

text:

text:
"I couldn't take care of George that day he was killed, but maybe by speaking with you today, I can help make sure that his death would not be in vain."

text:

name: NPR
text:

text:

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:

text:

text:
